Header: Heated debate in Parliament after Vasudeva Nanayakkara’s queries on official housing
Content: United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA) Parliamentarian Vasudeva Nanayakkara raised a question in Parliament on Tuesday on official housing which led to a heated debate in the chamber. UPFA MP, Vasudeva Nanayakkara stated: A document had been presented bearing the names of the minister and the parliamentarians who failed to return the official residences, and my name was also included to the list of names. He added: As an MP, I can claim an official residence. We informed the secretary to provide us with an official residence so we can leave the official residence that we are currently staying at. But we have not received anything as yet. We also informed the Secretary of Public Administration In reply to this statedment State Minister of Development Strategies and International Trade, Sujeewa Senasinghe stated: This is an opportunity given for MPs and Minister who do not have a residence in Colombo to claim for one. And we as ministers have not taken official residences because we have houses in Colombo. But he lives in Colombo, so why is he asking for another house from Colombo? The UNP MP, stated that he is the former Minister of National Languages,however, he used a number of unnecessary words. So remove them. He used words that are not suitable. He  added: We MPs live in Madiwela. So he can come to Madiwela and vacate the official residences of the ministers.
